newsitem.title: HUNGARY: BUDAPEST BOURSE PLUNGES TOGETHER WITH OTHERS.
newsitem.headline: BUDAPEST BOURSE PLUNGES TOGETHER WITH OTHERS.

text.p: The Hungarian share market joined tumbling European markets with leading stocks opening sharply lower, weighed on by Wall Street's plunge, traders said.
They said that the buying side was very weak in early trading and investors were unloading their papers.
"The heavy fall of the Dow Jones has had a substantial impact on the market," one trader said. "The essence of investors's activity is nothing else than to sell," he said.
"The market's sentiment is rather negative at opening thus we'll have a very heavy fall...maybe 200 points."
Early losers included meat processor Pick which plunged seven and half percent or 860 forints and at 0941 GMT it traded at 10,700.
Chemicals Borsodchem fell five percent in early trade and at 0947 GMT it stood at 6,190.
At 0944 GMT hotelier Danubius traded at 5,100 forints, down 200, while at 0946 GMT OTP Bank stood at 3,715 forints, down 145.
On Friday the BUX index closed at 5,413.70 points, down 25.27.
